label: Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP)
description: Enables continuous S&OP with integrated demand, supply, and financial planning plus instant scenario modeling and collaborative consensus.

traditionalApproach.description: Monthly S&OP meetings with disconnected planning tools and static plans
characteristics: Monthly S&OP meetings (slide decks)
Disconnected planning tools (demand, supply, finance use separate systems)
Manual consensus process
Static plans (updated monthly)
Limited scenario modeling
constraints: Monthly cycles too slow for dynamic market conditions
Limited ability to test scenarios and contingencies

contextualConstraints.content: Seasonal demand spikes from promotions and holidays cause stock-outs and lost sales, exacerbated by monthly planning cycles.
Perishable inventory management requires daily planning, but monthly S&OP cycles lead to food waste and supply chain inefficiencies.
Dynamic pricing and booking patterns require real-time capacity planning, but static monthly plans fail to capture market changes.
Menu item popularity shifts rapidly with trends, but monthly planning doesn't allow for quick supply chain adjustments.
Event-driven demand fluctuations require flexible planning, but monthly cycles can't respond to booking surges or cancellations.

agenticApproach.description: Continuous S&OP with integrated planning, instant scenarios, and faster consensus
characteristics: Consensus demand plan combines statistical, ML, and judgmental forecasts
Supply planning optimizes supply plan given demand and constraints
Financial planning translates plans to P&L impact automatically
Scenario agent simulates demand spikes, supplier failures, etc.
Consensus agent facilitates collaboration, resolves conflicts, tracks decisions
Continuous rolling S&OP process (weekly or real-time)
benefits: Continuous S&OP vs monthly batch cycles
Scenarios tested instantly vs days of analysis

projections.basis: Based on Gartner Supply Chain Management research (2024) showing AI-driven forecasting in continuous S&OP improves accuracy by 15-25% through integrated ML models and real-time data.

contextualBenefits.content: Continuous S&OP enables real-time response to promotional demand spikes, reducing stock-outs by 40% and increasing sales by 15%.
Daily planning optimization reduces perishable waste by 25% and improves inventory turnover by 30%.
Real-time capacity planning captures 20% more revenue from dynamic pricing and last-minute bookings.
Rapid supply chain adjustments to menu trends improve customer satisfaction scores by 15% and reduce food costs by 10%.
Flexible planning for events increases occupancy rates by 12% and reduces overbooking penalties.

quickWins: Deploy integrated S&OP platform for pilot category
Implement scenario modeling for top supply chain risks
prerequisites: Integrated S&OP platform (Anaplan, o9 Solutions, Kinaxis)
Clean demand, supply, and financial data

label: Supply Chain Control Tower
description: Provides end-to-end supply chain visibility with real-time exception detection, impact analysis, and automated resolution coordination.

traditionalApproach.description: No end-to-end visibility with reactive issue discovery and manual coordination
characteristics: No end-to-end visibility
Each party (suppliers, 3PLs, carriers) uses own system
Delays discovered reactively
Manual coordination when issues arise
constraints: Blind spots across supply chain partners
Reactive discovery of delays and issues
Manual status calls and email chasing
Slow response to exceptions (days to coordinate)

benchmarks.source: Council of Supply Chain Management Professionals (CSCMP) Annual Report 2024

contextualConstraints.content: Store stock-outs from supplier delays cost $1-2M per day in lost sales, with manual coordination taking days to resolve.
Perishable goods spoilage from transportation delays results in 2-5% inventory loss, with reactive discovery causing food waste.
Flight delays from baggage handling issues lead to passenger dissatisfaction and compensation costs, with poor visibility across partners.
Ingredient delivery delays cause menu item unavailability, reducing drive-thru efficiency and customer satisfaction.
Room readiness delays from linen/supply chain issues result in guest dissatisfaction and revenue loss from unavailable rooms.

agenticApproach.description: End-to-end visibility with early exception detection, automated impact analysis, and coordinated resolutions
characteristics: Multi-tier visibility tracks inventory, orders, shipments across all partners
Exception detection identifies delays, stock-outs, quality issues in real-time
Impact analysis calculates downstream effects (revenue, customer, operations)
Resolution orchestration coordinates responses (expedite, re-route, notify)
Integration with all supply chain systems (ERP, WMS, TMS, supplier portals)
Predictive alerts before issues occur
benefits: Exceptions detected in real-time vs reactive discovery
Impact quantified automatically vs manual assessment
Resolutions coordinated automatically vs email chains

projections.basis: Based on Forrester Supply Chain Technology Report (2024) showing control tower implementations reduce exception resolution time by 60-80% through automated coordination.
Based on Gartner Supply Chain Cost Management research (2024) demonstrating early detection enables cost-effective alternatives to expedited shipping.

contextualBenefits.content: Real-time visibility prevents $500K+ daily stock-out losses and enables proactive replenishment, improving availability by 25%.
Predictive alerts for perishable delays reduce waste by 30% and ensure fresh product availability for customers.
End-to-end baggage tracking reduces mishandling claims by 40% and improves passenger experience scores.
Automated coordination ensures ingredient availability, reducing menu unavailability by 50% and improving service speed.
Supply chain visibility ensures room readiness, increasing occupancy rates by 8% and guest satisfaction scores.

quickWins: Deploy control tower for top 20% of SKUs by revenue
Implement exception alerts for critical shipments
Enable impact analysis for stock-out scenarios
prerequisites: Supply chain visibility platform (FourKites, project44, BluJay)
Real-time order and shipment tracking data

label: Network Optimization
description: Continuously optimizes distribution network configuration with data-driven recommendations, scenario testing, and ROI quantification.

traditionalApproach.description: Static DC network with manual analysis and gut-feel decisions
characteristics: Static DC network (rarely changes)
Manual analysis for network changes
No continuous optimization
Decisions based on gut feel
constraints: No continuous optimization as demand shifts
No agility to respond to market changes

agenticApproach.description: Network optimized continuously with data-driven recommendations, ROI quantified, and faster decisions
characteristics: Demand pattern analysis identifies geographic demand shifts
Cost modeling calculates total landed cost (storage, transport, handling)
Scenario testing simulates network configurations (open DC, close DC, re-allocate)
Recommendation agent suggests network changes with quantified ROI
Continuous monitoring flags when network becomes suboptimal
Simulation-based what-if analysis
benefits: Continuous network optimization vs 3-5 year static cycles
ROI quantified before changes vs post-hoc justification
Decisions made in weeks vs months of analysis
Agility to respond to market shifts

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on continuous network optimization vs static 3-5 year cycles']

quickWins: Deploy network design tool for annual planning cycle
Model total landed cost for top distribution lanes
Run scenario tests for top 3 network change options
prerequisites: Network design tool (COUPA, LLamasoft, Llamasoft anyLogistix)

label: Allocation & Replenishment Optimization
description: Optimizes inventory allocation and replenishment with ML-driven demand forecasting, dynamic reorder points, and automated transfers.

traditionalApproach.description: Fixed allocation rules and static reorder points with common stock-outs and overstock
characteristics: Allocation rules fixed (equal split, sales history)
Replenishment based on reorder points
No ML-based optimization
Stock-outs and overstock common
constraints: Fixed rules don't adapt to demand changes
Static reorder points cause stock-outs and overstock
Manual safety stock calculations outdated quickly

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Inventory availability benchmarks']

agenticApproach.description: Inventory where needed with reduced stock-outs and overstock through automated transfers
characteristics: Demand-driven allocation directs inventory to highest-likelihood locations
Dynamic replenishment uses ML-driven reorder points (not static)
Transfer optimization automates store-to-store transfers
Safety stock agent calculates optimal safety stock per SKU/location
Continuous monitoring and adjustment
Integration with demand forecasting

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on ML-driven allocation and dynamic reorder points']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on demand-driven allocation vs fixed rules']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on inventory positioned where demand occurs']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on optimized safety stock and reduced overstock']

quickWins: Deploy ML-based replenishment for top 20% of SKUs
Implement automated transfer recommendations for high-velocity items
Enable dynamic safety stock calculation for seasonal products
prerequisites: Transfer cost and lead time data
Historical sales and stock-out data for ML training

label: Supplier Collaboration Platform
description: Enables real-time supplier collaboration with shared forecasts, automated PO management, and performance monitoring.

traditionalApproach.description: Email-based supplier communication with manual PO management and spreadsheet tracking
characteristics: Email-based communication with suppliers
Manual PO management
No shared forecasts
Supplier performance tracked in spreadsheets
constraints: Email creates communication delays and errors
Manual PO management slow and error-prone
Suppliers have no visibility into demand forecast
No systematic issue escalation or tracking

agenticApproach.description: Real-time collaboration with automated POs, forecast transparency, and visible performance
characteristics: Forecast sharing provides rolling forecasts to suppliers securely
PO management automates generation, acknowledgment, changes
Performance monitoring tracks OTD, quality, responsiveness
Issue resolution escalates issues and tracks resolution
Supplier portal provides self-service access
Collaboration on new product development
benefits: Automated PO management vs manual processes

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on forecast transparency improving supplier planning']

quickWins: Deploy supplier portal for top 20 suppliers
Automate PO generation and acknowledgment via EDI/API
Share rolling 13-week forecast with strategic suppliers
prerequisites: Supplier portal platform or custom build
Demand forecast system for forecast sharing
Supplier agreement to adopt collaborative tools

label: Cross-Docking & Flow-Through
description: Increases cross-dock percentage by 40%+ with automated eligibility, dock scheduling, sortation, and throughput tracking.

traditionalApproach.description: Inventory stored in DCs for days/weeks with no cross-docking capability
characteristics: Inventory stored in DCs for days/weeks
No cross-docking capability
High storage costs
Slow throughput
constraints: High storage costs for fast-moving items

agenticApproach.description: Cross-dock percentage increased, dwell time reduced, throughput increased, storage costs down
characteristics: Eligibility agent identifies SKUs suitable for cross-dock (fast movers, promotional)
Dock scheduling optimizes inbound/outbound dock assignments
Sortation agent directs received inventory to outbound staging
Performance agent tracks cross-dock %, dwell time, throughput
Integration with WMS, YMS, TMS
Automated flow-through decisions

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automated eligibility and optimized dock scheduling']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on flow-through vs storage in DC']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on optimized sortation and dock scheduling']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on reduced dwell time for fast-moving items']

quickWins: Deploy cross-dock eligibility rules for top 100 SKUs
Enable performance tracking dashboard for cross-dock KPIs
prerequisites: Warehouse Management System (WMS) with cross-dock functionality
Yard Management System (YMS) for dock scheduling
